Substitute Bus Driver Position Open:

Notice of Vacancy dates: June 30, 2020
Hillsboro City Schools 39 Willettsville Pike Hillsboro, OH 45133 Telephone: 937-393-3475 Fax: 937-393-5841

Applications are being accepted for the following position for the 2020-2021 school year Substitute Bus Driver

Qualifications:
• High School diploma or general education degree (GED).
• Commercial Driver’s License (CDL) with bus driver endorsement.
• Must be twenty-one (21) years of age with at least five (5) years of driving experience.
• Must possess no more than two (2) points on driving record (abstract) within the last two (2) years from the Bureau of Motor Vehicles and no DUI’s.
• Must acquire a pre-service certificate.
• Must pass a physical examination.
• Must pass drug and alcohol testing.
• Must pass criminal background check.

Location: Transportation Department

Wages: Per Hillsboro City Schools substitute classified employee pay scale

Contracted days: as needed

Applications/resumes or questions may be directed to Transportation Supervisor, Ron Ward - 393-4471.

Charter will be offering free Spectrum broadband and Wi-Fi access for 60 days to households with K-12 or college students who do not currently have service.

It will start Monday, March 16, and be available for 60 days.

You must call 1-844-488-8395 to enroll. Installation fees will be waived for new student households.

It will also open its Wi-Fi hotspots for public use.

Charter said broadband internet access will be increasingly essential in making sure people across the country are able to learn and work remotely, that businesses can continue to serve customers, and that Americans stay connected and engaged with family and friends amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

HMS STUDENTS NAMED AMONG WINNERS OF THE NATIONWIDE SUPER SLEEP CONTEST!!!

Five students from Hillsboro Middle School were awarded by GENYOUth, through their flagship Fuel Up to Play 60 program, and Sleep Number, the smart bed company, as winners of the Super Sleep Contest. Students were asked to create a 90-second video that highlights what they can accomplish with quality sleep. GENYOUth received entries from over 25 states. Locally, the winning students, Morgan G., Ramsey H., Addyson M., Riley S., and Gracie T. emphasized the importance of getting quality sleep each night, shared tips for removing sleep distractions from their rooms and suggested creating and sticking to a regular sleep schedule. They also raised their voices about the benefits of a good night’s sleep, including better focus, concentration and sports performance. Hillsboro Middle School will receive a Super Sleep Toolkit for use in classrooms with educational resources provided by Sleep Number. Congratulations!

The Hillsboro FFA helps Families at Christmas

This year The Hillsboro FFA chapter completed their annual Christmas “adopt-a-family” program a little differently. Instead of providing gifts for several kids in their school district, they sponsored multiple families from Community Action. FFA members went shopping for the families to buy clothes, hats, gloves, etc. “It’s really great to be able to be involved and help the families in need in our own community,” said FFA member Kelcie Thornburgh.

The money used to purchase the Christmas gifts was made by the Tractor Raffle. Instead of having the annual FFA 5k, the chapter held a Tractor Raffle and earned a total of $1,118. Hillsboro FFA held the Tractor Raffle as a fundraiser to provide for families in need. Every year, members of the Hillsboro FFA Chapter look forward to having a fundraiser in order to be able to adopt families and make sure they have a Merry Christmas!

Written by: Lawton Parry

Pictured left to right: Christine Paige, Kelcie Thornburgh, and Mallory Parsons shopping for adopt-a-family

Hillsboro FFA Fruit Sale

The Hillsboro FFA Chapters fruit sale has finally come to an end. The members in the chapter were asked to sell fruit for a fundraiser to help keep the chapter running. The members worked hard to sell as much fruit as they possibly could, and in March they will be recognized for how much fruit they sold. In the Hillsboro FFA Chapter, the top fruit salesman was Joe Helterbrand, with $2,878 worth of sales.

In the fruit sale, the FFA sells a variety of items: oranges, grapefruit, tangerines, apples, pineapples, nuts, meat, and cheese. This year, the chapter raised $7,602 to help cover chapter expenses. The chapter would like to say thank you again to all of the customers and the members who went out of their way to sell fruit this year. Riley Strattion said, “Selling fruit is a big part of our fundraising and we appreciate the support from the community.”

Written by: Katie Craig

Pictured L-R: Lora Mayhan, and Claire Wilkin.
